helperText.description: In order to use Cellebrite to diagnose your customer’s device, there are a few things you’ll need to do first:

steps.step: Select Diagnostics from the Cellebrite main menu screen, and enter your ID.
Connect the device you wish to test, being sure to use the correct cable for that device. Cellebrite should automatically recognize the device you’ve connected.
Select the issue you would like to test. You’ll see a screen with various test options to choose from.
Follow the prompts and instructions on the device and on the Cellebrite screen.

helperText.title: Test and repair:
helperText.description: Once Cellebrite has diagnosed the issue, it will recommend some ways that the issue might be resolved. Some repairs might require your input and others will be resolved automatically.
helperText.helpText: Here are the different kind of tests you’ll encounter.

subSteps: Fully automatic tests are used to test connectivity and performance issues. Cellebrite will perform these tests automatically.
Semi-automatic tests are used to test camera and sound functions, as well as hardware issues. These tests will require some engagement on your part.

steps.step: Some tests might require that you reset the customer’s device. If so, be sure to backup the device before doing so—Cellebrite will prompt you to perform this backup, if necessary.
If the issue can be resolved or improved by changing settings, Cellebrite has a function to optimize the settings of the device.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Airvoice Wireless
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Airvoice Wireless account for.
accountNumber: Account number is the SIM Card number.
pin: pin is last four-digits of phone number being ported.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: AT&T
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the AT&T account for.
accountNumber: 12-digit account number can be found:
In the upper right-hand corner of their bill
In the online account, For bundled bills, the account number is a 12-digit number under the wireless account 'summary'.
For older or linked AT&T accounts, AT&T should be contacted to find out what the account number is, Only AT&T Wireless should be used, not U-verse.
pin: The 'pin' is given by AT&T and is usually pre-selected.
To get their 'pin', a customer can call 800-331-0500 (from a wireless phone) or 800-288-2020 (from a landline), or visit an AT&T store.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: AT&T Prepaid
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the AT&T Prepaid account for
accountNumber: For the account number, the customer should call the AT&T Number Transfer Request Line at 888-898-7685
pin: For the four-digit 'pin', the customer should call the AT&T Number Transfer Request Line at 888-898-7685.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: AT&T Landline
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the AT&T Landline account for
accountNumber: The account number is the nine-digit landline phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is the four digits to the immediate right of the phone number in the top right corner of the customer’s bill.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Black Wireless
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Black Wireless Wireless account for
summary: The customer needs to call customer service at 800-643-4926 to release the number for porting.
While calling, the customer can confirm the account number and 'pin' with them.
The customer will be asked to provide the three most recent outgoing calls.
accountNumber: Account number is the 20-digits of the SIM card number.
pin: The 'pin' is last four digits of SIM card number.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Boost Mobile
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Boost Mobile account for
accountNumber: The customer should call Boost at 1-888-266-7848 to get the nine-digit account number.
To reach a live person the customer should do the following:
Wait for the opening message to go to English.
When prompted, enter your Boost phone number
Press option '4' when the system says 'Technical Issues, press 4'
Listen to all of the menu options.
At the end of the menu options, wait 10 seconds.
Press '0' to talk to a Boost Customer Care Representative
When prompted, enter your four-digit Boost 'pin' number.
Wait to be transferred to a Boost Representative.
Ask the account representative to give you the account number for your personal record.
pin: The four-digit 'pin' is the same 'pin' that the customer uses to log in.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Comcast Digital Voice
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the CDV account for
accountNumber: The customer can find the account number:
In the upper right-hand corner of the bill
In the online My Account portal on the Digital copy of the bill
Account number is not the phone number. It is a 16-digit or 13-digit number.
pin: The 'pin' is the last 4 of the SSN.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Consumer Cellular
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Consumer Cellular account for
accountNumber: The name and address must match.
pin: The 'pin' is usually the last four-digits of the customer’s SSN.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Cricket
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Cricket account for
accountNumber: The account number can be found online by logging into the customer account or by calling the Cricket Porting Department at 866-351-7678 (then option #2).
pin: The 'pin' is the four-digit Authorization ID (or 'AID') that the customer set up when activating the online account and that is needed to enter when making changes to the account online.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:FreedomPop
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the FreedomPop account for
accountNumber: The account number can be found online by logging in to the FreedomPop account and navigating to My Account > Account Settings.
pin: The 'pin' can be found online by logging in to the FreedomPop account and navigating to My Account > Account Settings.

Free accounts:  In order for the customer to retrieve the correct 'pin' for their free FreedomPop account, the customer must chat with a Representative via the online forum. The customer can not call and speak to a representative or chat real time since those means of support are reserved for premium accounts.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Google Fi
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Google Fi account for
summary: The customer should cancel their service first:
Open the Google Fi app or website (https://fi.google.com/account).
In the Account tab, go to Your Plan.
Choose to Transfer your number to another carrier.
After completing the process, the customer is provided with the account number and password.
accountNumber: The account number is provided when the customer cancels their service.
pin: The 'pin' (password) is provided when the customer cancels their service.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Google Voice
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Google Voice account for
summary: The customer must unlock their number before proceeding.
The customer’s full name and address must match
It takes 4 to 7 business days to complete the porting process.
There's a $3 charge to port from Google Voice, unless the number was ported in to Google Voice.
accountNumber: The account number is the 10-digit phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is the last four digits of the phone number, unless the customer changed it.
The 'pin' is what the customer uses to access your Google Voice voicemail from a different phone.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: GoSmart
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the GoSmart account for
accountNumber: The account number is your phone number.
pin: The four-digit 'pin' number is the same 'pin' used when calling customer service.

If the customer does not have a 'pin', they can set it up by calling 611 from their GoSmart phone, saying 'no' when it asked if they want to refill, choosing 'Manage my account', and choosing 'change my account' pin

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: H20 Wireless
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the H20 Wireless account for
summary: The customer needs to call customer service at 800-643-4926 to release the number for porting. While calling, the customer can confirm the account number and 'pin' with them. The customer will be asked to provide the three most recent outgoing calls.
accountNumber: Account number is the 20-digits of the SIM card number.
pin: The 'pin' is last four digits of SIM card number.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Line 2 / Toktumi
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Line 2 / Toktumi account for
summary: Porting can take between 3 to 5 days.
The customer needs to cancel their service after the porting has been completed by following the directions in the article 'Cancel your Line2 Account.'
accountNumber: The account number is the phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is the login passcode.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Lycamobile
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Lycamobile account for
accountNumber: The customer needs to call customer service at 866-277-3221 to get the account number.
pin: The customer needs to call customer service at 866-277-3221 to get the 'pin'.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Metro PCS
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Metro PCS account for
accountNumber: The account number is a nine-digit number (not the phone number) and can be found on the online profile.
pin: The passcode is the call-in passcode (usually eight-digit birthday unless the customer changed it).

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Net10
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Net10 account for
accountNumber: The account number is the MEID or IMEI serial number of the phone, which is found on the back of the phone itself under the battery. The battery needs to be removed to read it. If the customer is using a BYOP SIM card, the account number the last 15 digits of your SIM card number.
pin: NET10 does not use pin's. Use 0000 for the 'pin'.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Ooma
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Ooma account for
accountNumber: The account number is only provided by calling Ooma customer service.
pin: The 'pin' is only provided by calling Ooma customer service.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Page Plus
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Page Plus account for
accountNumber: The account number is the 10-digit phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is the last 4 digits of the phone number, unless the customer changed it.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:PTel
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the PTel account for
accountNumber: Account number is the phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is four-digit account 'pin', which can be found by going to Ptel.com, logging in to My Account, and clicking Account Details. or by calling PTel at 866-225-5631.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Red Pocket (GSMA, GSMT)
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Red Pocket account for
accountNumber: Account number is the 10-digit phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is last four digits of the SIM ID.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Red Pocket (CDMAS, CDMAV)
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Red Pocket account for
accountNumber: Account number is the 10-digit phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is last four digits of the phone's MEID or ESN serial number.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Republic Wireless
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Republic Wireless account for
accountNumber: Account number is the customer's Republic Wireless 10 digit phone number.
pin: As a service provider, Republic Wireless does not set a 'pin' for their customers.
However, they suggest that the customer use a 4-6 digit number that they can easily remember.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:RingPlus
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the RingPlus account for
accountNumber: The account number is the 10-digit phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is located online, in the dashboard, under Your Device.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:SafeLink Wireless
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the SafeLink Wireless account for
accountNumber: The account number is the phone's IMEI.
pin: There is no 'pin'.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Selectel Wireless
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Selectel Wireless account for
accountNumber: The account number is an 8-digit number, displayed as 'Account' in online account page.
pin: The 'pin' is your four-digit 'pin' if you set one up.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Simple Mobile
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Simple Mobile account for
accountNumber: The account number is the last 15 digits of the SIM card number.

Note: The Zip Code that is used to port the MDN from Simple Mobile is the Zip Code of the store where the customer first established their Simple Mobile account.  This is referred to as the “Activation Zip Code”.
pin: The 'pin' is the online password (or last eight digits of the SIM card number if the customer did not change it).

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Solavei
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Solavei account for.
accountNumber: The account number is the 10-digit phone number.
pin: The 'pin' is the ZIP Code.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Sprint
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Sprint account for
accountNumber: The 9-digit account number can be found:
In the top center of the bill
In the online account
Account number is not the phone number. It is a 9-digit number.
pin: The 6-10 digit 'pin' is the same as their call-in passcode and can be viewed or changed from the online account.
If the customer does not have access to an online account, they can call Sprint at 888-211-4727, *2 (from a wireless phone), or visit a Sprint store.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Straight Talk
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Straight Talk account for
accountNumber: The account number is the MEID or IMEI serial number of the phone, which is found on the back of the phone itself under the battery. The battery needs to be removed to read it. If the customer is using a BYOP SIM card, the account number the last 15 digits of your SIM card number.
pin: The 'pin' is located in the online Straight Talk or TracFone profile page and is usually last four-digits of the phone number.
For BYOP SIMs, the 'pin' is the last four digits of the SIM ID. If no 'pin' is listed, the customer can set one up before porting.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Telcel America
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Straight Talk account for
accountNumber: The account number is the MEID or IMEI serial number of the phone, which is found on the back of the phone itself under the battery. The battery needs to be removed to read it. If the customer is using a BYOP SIM card, the account number the last 15 digits of your SIM card number.
pin: The 'pin' is located in the online Straight Talk or TracFone profile page and is usually last four-digits of the phone number.
For BYOP SIMs, the 'pin' is the last four digits of the SIM ID. If no 'pin' is listed, the customer can set one up before porting.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Ting
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Ting account for
accountNumber: The account number is at the top of your online statement.
pin: The 'pin' on CDMA accounts is the phone's MSL, which can be found on the Devices page of the online Ting profile, or in the activation email.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: T-Mobile
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the T-Mobile account for
accountNumber: The 9-digit account number can be found:
In the upper right-hand corner of the bill.
In the online account.
Account number is not the phone number. It is a 9-digit number.
pin: The 'pin' is the last 4 of the SSN, unless the customer changed it.  If they don't remember their 'pin' they can call T-Mobile at 877-453-1304 or visit a T-Mobile store.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:T-Mobile Prepaid
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the T-Mobile Prepaid account for
accountNumber: The account number is the 11-digit phone number (1-NNN-NNN-NNNN).
pin: The passcode is the four-digit 'pin' number used when calling customer service.
The porting department can be reached at 1-877-789-3106 if the customer does not know their 'pin'.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:TracFone
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the TracFone account for
accountNumber: The account number is the MEID or IMEI serial number of the phone, which is found on the back of the phone itself under the battery. The battery needs to be removed to read it. If the customer is using a BYOP SIM card, the account number the last 15 digits of your SIM card number.
pin: The 'pin' is located in the online Straight Talk or TracFone profile page and is usually last four-digits of the phone number.
For BYOP SIMs, the 'pin' is the last four digits of the SIM ID.
If no 'pin' is listed, the customer can set one up before porting.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Ultra Mobile
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Ultra Mobile account for
accountNumber: The account number is in the top left corner of the online account management portal at ultra.me.
If the customer does not have an ultra.me account, they can call Ultra customer service at 888-777-0446 to get the account number.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: U.S. Cellular
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the U.S. Cellular account for
accountNumber: To obtain the account number, please contact U.S. Cellular at 888-944-9400.
pin: 'pin' number is the 4 digit 'pin' associated with the customer's account
If they do not know it, you will need to contact U.S. Cellular at 888-944-9400

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Verizon Prepaid
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Verizon Prepaid account for
accountNumber: The account Number is 10 digits, a dash ( - ) and 00001 (for example, 0123456789-00001)
pin: The 'pin' is the four-digit security 'pin'.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook:Verizon Wireless
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Verizon Wireless account for
accountNumber: The 14-digit account number can be found:
In upper right-hand cordern of a previous bill or their account-overview page online
The account number on bill ends in 00001.
pin: Initially set to the last 4 digits of customer’s SSN unless the customer changed it.
The 'pin' is a “call in password” that is used when calling customer service.
If the customer does not know their 'pin', they can call Verizon at 800-922-0204, or visit a Verizon store.

carriers.headline: Porting playbook: Virgin Mobile
carriers.playbookLine: You’ll need to enter account details from the Virgin Mobile account for
accountNumber: The nine-digit account can be obtained by calling Virgin Mobile.
pin: The 'pin' is usually the customer's birthday in six-digit format (two-digit month/two-digit day/two-digit year.F011065 for January 10, 1965) unless the customer changed it to something else.

accountNumber: The account number can be found on an old bill or your previous carrier's website
pin: Your old carrier requires a PIN to process your number transfer
Contact them if you don't know your PIN
defaultInfo.playbookLine: Enter account details from your previous carrier for

body.note: XFINITY Mobile has partnered with Assurant to offer an extra layer of protection for your <brand> <deviceName>. For $12/month, here's what you can expect:

appleCare.title: AppleCare +
appleCare.note: Your protection plan gives you direct access to the benefits of AppleCare Services. If you decide not to purchase XMPP, you can still buy AppleCare Services from Apple.

upgradeFee.title: No early-upgrade fees
upgradeFee.note: No more waiting forever or paying top dollar to get your hands on the newest phone release. With XMPP, you can upgrade your phone every 12 months*, no early-upgrade fee required.

damage.title: Accidental-damage protection
damage.nonApple: Drops, spills, and cracks happen to the best of us. Your protection plan has your back for accidental damage that’s not covered under your manufacturer’s warranty.

stolenCoverage.title: Lost or stolen coverage
stolenCoverage.appleNote: When your phone is lost or stolen, you need help stat! Your protection plan includes lost and stolen coverage so you can get a phone replacement quickly (a deductible is required).
stolenCoverage.otherNote: When your phone is lost or stolen, you need help stat! Your protection plan includes lost and stolen coverage so you can get a phone replacement quickly (deductible required).

techPro.title: Personal TechPro
techPro.note: Get phone support to connect and manage third-party apps and devices for video streaming, fitness tracking, smart home, and more.<

footer.info: If you’re on a Device Payment Plan, you’ll be eligible for an upgrade one year from purchase if your phone is in good working condition and you’ve made half of your device payments.
footer.cancelNote: You can cancel your protection plan at any time — just give us a call at (888) 936-4968.

select_devices.title: Device refund will be based on its condition
select_devices.description: Your device will be evaluated when you send it back to us. Assuming it’s in like-new condition, you’ll be refunded for the cost of the device.  If your device is damaged you may incur charges.

suspend_confirmation.title: You’ll be refunded for any usage and service costs
suspend_confirmation.description: You’ll be refunded for any service-related charges including:

GRADE_MESSAGES.A: Device Grade A: This device passed device condition eligibility.
GRADE_MESSAGES.B: Device Grade B: This device passed device condition eligibility.
GRADE_MESSAGES.C: Device Grade C: This device is not eligible for and [Return/Exchange/Upgrade.]
GRADE_MESSAGES.D: Device Grade D: This device is not eligible for and [Return/Exchange/Upgrade.]

UPGRADE_DEVICE_QUESTIONNAIRE.script: Is the display cracked, broken or otherwise damaged (e.g. discoloration)?
Is there any physical damage to the back, charging port or buttons?
Any liquid damage? (e.g. moisture under the screen, discoloration of device)

upgradeReturn.returnSuccess: To continue, you must print the return merchandise authorization (RMA). After activating the new device, wrap the RMA around the old device and prepare it for shipment to Assurant.
upgradeReturn.returnFailure: The order was successfully placed, however, the return merchandise authorization (RMA) could not be created at this time. You can continue with activating the new device, then try again to create the RMA once activation is complete.

voicemailPageContent.name: Create voicemail box
voicemailPageContent.description: If a customer’s voicemail box was not created when their phone was activated, you can create a new mailbox for them.

voicemailPageContent.name: Re-create voicemail box
voicemailPageContent.description: If a customer has an active MDN but does not have their voicemail set up, you can use this option to re-create, or re-provision, their mailbox. After re-creating the mailbox, the customer should be able to access their voicemail through the Visual Voicemail App or via IVR by dialing *86 or holding the 1 key.

voicemailPageContent.name: Reset voicemail PIN
voicemailPageContent.description: If a customer is unable to access their voicemail, you can try resetting their PIN. Resetting the PIN will not delete previous voicemails but it will reset the customer's greeting.
voicemailPageContent.descriptionPin: Once the PIN is reset, the customer can hold the 1 key to reach their voicemail via IVR and set up a new PIN and re-record their preferred greeting.
voicemailPageContent.descriptionNote: Note: A PIN is not required to use the Visual Voicemail App. It is only needed to listen to voicemails via IVR.

voicemailPageContent.name: iPhone voicemail support
voicemailPageContent.description: We're unable to offer support for the iOS voicemail application. Customers with iPhones should be directed to Apple's visual voicemail support page.

cancel.confirm: Are you sure you want to cancel XMPP?
cancel.infoToAgent: Please inform the customer that once you cancel XMPP on a device, they will not be able to re-add XMPP. This is important for the customer to know.

canceled.header: XMPP was cancelled for this device
text: You are not able to submit a claim because this device no longer has XMPP.
The customer is not able to add XMPP back onto their device.
If the deivce was delayed because of shipping, a manager can override the 30 Day Open Enrollment. You’ll need to escalate this issue in dispositioning
It could be a warranty issue. Head over to Orders & Returns to see if they could return the device.

claim.text: You’ll be taken over to the Assurant Portal to submit the claim for the customers. This process can take up to 10mins. Make sure the customer is aware of this before proceeding.

cancel.text: Start the process for cancelling device protection. Once the device protection plan is cancelled, this device is no longer eligible for XMPP.

xmppInfo.header: This device is not eligible to be enrolled in XMPP.

deactivationPopupContent.title: Line Deactivation
deactivationPopupContent.subTitle: Deactivated lines cannot be re-activated in XM360. This should not be used as a troubleshooting process.
deactivationPopupContent.verificationOne: I verify that I am not deactivating lines to troubleshoot an issue.
deactivationPopupContent.verificationTwo: I understand that XMPP will be removed from this device and cannot be added back.
deactivationPopupContent.verificationThree: The customer is aware that Xfinity Mobile will only hold their MDN for 30 days after a line is deactivated.

current-cycle.title: Switch to Unlimited (current cycle)
current-cycle.agentHelpText1: This switch to the Unlimited data option will be effective immediately. It will result in a <pro_rated_charge> charge in the customer's current billing cycle.
current-cycle.agentHelpText2: By the Gig fees incurred on this line will be forgiven, but any data usage that's already happened this cycle will continue to count toward the <throttle_limit> limit, at which point data speeds will be reduced.
current-cycle.agentHelpText3: If the customer wants to switch back to By the Gig to avoid the <pro_rated_charge> charge and keep faster personal hotspot speeds, they're free to do so before the current bill cycle ends.
current-cycle.hotspotDPFO: When using a device as a personal hotspot on the Unlimited data option, speeds on secondary devices connected to the hotspot will not exceed 600 Kbps. At that speed, customers will be able to perform common tasks such as email and basic web browsing. Only the By the Gig data option allows for 4G LTE speeds on secondary devices connected to a personal hotspot.
current-cycle.customerSave: <nickname> will save money by switching to Unlimited!
current-cycle.alertUsage: This line has used more than <throttle_limit> of data this cycle. The customer may experience reduced speeds with the Unlimited data option until the new billing cycle begins.
current-cycle.customerWarn: Switching to Unlimited will increase the customer's bill for the current cycle. Recommend that they stick with By the Gig.

current-cycle.title: Switch to By The Gig (current cycle)
current-cycle.agentHelpText1: This plan switch will be effective immediately, and will charge the customer the standard rate <plan_rate> for any data used in the cycle so far. Depending on usage, this may be higher than the <current_rate> Unlimited plan charge
current-cycle.agentHelpText2: Any data usage so far continues to count towards the <throttle_limit> throttle limit
current-cycle.agentHelpText3: <nickname> can switch back any time before the cycle ends.
current-cycle.customerWarn: Switching to By the Gig will increase the customer's bill for the current cycle. Recommend that they stick with Unlimited.
current-cycle.alertUsage: This line has used more than <throttle_limit> of data this cycle. The customer may experience reduced speeds with the Unlimited data option until the new billing cycle begins.

next-cycle.title: Switch to By the Gig (next cycle)
next-cycle.agentHelpText1: This plan switch will be effective on the first day of the next billing cycle. You can switch back at any time before the cycle ends.

refundOptions.help_info: You'll also be refunded for any usage and sevice costs on your next monthly bill.

restokingFee.body: The $35.00 restocking fee will be waived from this customers statement.

RETURN_CONFIRMATION_1.title: Device refund will be based on its condition
RETURN_CONFIRMATION_1.description: Your device will be evaluated when you send it back to us. Assuming it’s in like-new condition, you’ll be refunded for the cost of the device.  If your device is damaged you may incur charges.

RETURN_CONFIRMATION_3.title: You’ll be refunded for any usage and sevice costs
RETURN_CONFIRMATION_3.subtitle: These charges will be refund on your monthly bill.

returnConfirmation.ExchangeTotalText: The customer is not charged for this purchase. A payment or refund will happen once the returned device is graded at XPO and other additional deees are applied.
returnConfirmation.ExchangeFraudQueue: This order is in a review process for fraud.  Orders in fraud review can not be sent to XPO until they are cleared.

MAIL_BACK.title: Mail your items back
MAIL_BACK.description: Print your return label and send your items back to us, including your device, battery, charger, and manual.

KEEP_AN_EYE_OUT_FOR_EMAIL.title: Keep an eye out for an email
KEEP_AN_EYE_OUT_FOR_EMAIL.description: We’ll send you an email when we receive your returned item(s). From there, it can take up to 10 days to process your return.

REVIEW.title: We’ll review your device

DeviceDetailsAlertMsg.TestAlert: To run diagnostics on a customer's Apple device, follow these steps:

TestAlertSteps.step: Select Initiate Test on any test to activate the diagnostics tool on the customer's device.
Instruct the customer to launch diagnostics:
substeps: On devices running iOS 10.3 or later, ask the customer to go to Settings > Privacy Analytics > Start Diagnostics with Apple Support.
On devices running iOS 10.2.1 or earlier, ask the customer to go to Settings > Privacy Diagnostics & Usage > Start Diagnostics with Apple Support.

TestAlertSteps.step: After the customer begins diagnostics, ask them to agree to the terms and conditions by selecting Agree.
Select Initiate Test again to begin the desired test.
Ask the customer to remain on screen until the test has completed.
Once all tests are finished and you see the results, ask the customer to tap the blue button with three dots.

summary.title: Order summary
summary.body: The estimated upfront taxes, fees and other charges for this order are $[taxes]. The estimated order total is $[total].

disclosures.title: Disclosures
disclosures.body: Lastly, I'll run through some important details about the terms and conditions of your order.
disclosures.autoPay:
Your account will be set for automatic recurring monthly card payments for your Xfinity Mobile charges.

If we are unable to charge your card, we will suspend your Xfinity Mobile service and require that you immediately pay the entire outstanding balance of your Xfinity Mobile services in full before restoring your services.

The account commencement date, which establishes the bill cycle date for your account, is the earlier of the date of the first Device activated on your account, or 7 days after the first order is shipped on your account.

Because XFINITY Mobile only provides electronic billing and communications we need you to provide your verbal consent that you agree to be billed and communicated with electronically. Do you agree to the use of electronic records and signatures in accordance with the ESIGN Act and Disclosure Agreement?

returns.device_return_and_cancellation_policy:
You have 14 days from the date your Device is shipped to return your Device for a refund. If you request for the service to be cancelled within that period, you will not incur any monthly charges for those lines. In order to receive a refund for the Device it must be returned to us in like-new condition. Like-new condition means that the Device has no physical or liquid damage, is unlocked and is returned with the manufacturer's original packaging and all original components that were provided with the device, including the battery, charger, documentation, SIM card (if applicable), and a copy of the invoice or receipt. There is a $35 restocking fee for each Device you return.

Find my iPhone or Find my Device must be disabled, or the device will be charged in full. You may find the instruction to do so by visiting Apple.com
returns.accessory_return_policy: You have 30 days from the date of your Accessory is shipped to return your Accessory for a refund.
returns.byod_cancellation_policy: You have 14 days from the date your SIM card is shipped to cancel your service as part of the cancellation policy, and you will not incur any monthly charges for that line.
returns.device_payment_plan_cancellation_policy: If you cancel your Xfinity Mobile service after the first 14 days and maintain at least one of Xfinity TV, Internet or Voice, you will still be responsible for the remainder of the 24 payments, but you can continue to pay in monthly installments. If you cancel your Xfinity Mobile service for all the lines of service on your account after the first 14 days and no longer maintain at least one of the following services: Xfinity TV, Internet or Voice, we will require you to immediately pay the entire remaining balance in full.
returns.cancellation_of_other_xfinity_services: While you are an Xfinity Internet, TV, or Voice customer, your Xfinity Mobile line charges are included.  If you fail to subscribe to at least one of these services, you will be charged $10 per line each month.  Any applicable termination fee associated with other Xfinity services will apply if you cancel such other services and retain the Xfinity Mobile service.
returns.prepaid_card: To qualify for your prepaid card, you must maintain the services and other conditions required for the offer for 90 days and keep your account in good standing. The $[content] will be mailed approximately 16-18 weeks after service/device activation.

conclusion.title: conclusion
conclusion.body:
By approving this order you represent that you are at least 18 years of age are the holder of this Xfinity Mobile account and agree to be billed for the equipment and services that I just described.

Do you approve this order?

Thank you. After we finalize your order, you’ll receive a copy of your order summary at the email address listed on your account.

promotionPricing.text: Offer ends [promotionEndDate]. Restrictions apply. Not available in all areas. Requires a post-pay subscription to a residential XFINITY Internet service. New XFINITY Internet customers limited to 2 lines pending activation of Internet service. Offer requires activation of a new Xfinity Mobile line with By the Gig or Unlimited data option and purchase of a [deviceList] from Xfinity Mobile. Must remain an Xfinity Mobile customer with account in good standing for first 90 days following Xfinity Mobile line activation. [PrepaidCardAmount] Prepaid card fulfilled through Visa® Prepaid Card. Cards issued by MetaBank®, Member FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa® U.S.A., Inc. Prepaid Card mailed to Comcast account holder within 16-18 weeks of activation of all required services and expires in 180 days. New purchases only while supplies last. Not valid with prior purchases, returns or exchanges. Limit of 5 prepaid cards per customer/account. If multiple lines ordered at the same time, one card issued for the total qualifying amount. © 2018 Comcast. All rights reserved. To see the XFINITY Mobile Broadband Disclosures, visit: www.xfinity.com/mobile/policies/broadband-disclosures
